properties.name: context
properties.description: The request context associated with the object. This connects the add-in's process to the Office host application's process.

examples.description: Access the request context from a ParagraphCollection to verify the connection between the add-in and Word, then use it to load and sync paragraph data.

properties.name: items
properties.description: Gets the loaded child items in this collection.

examples.description: Create a new list starting from the second paragraph in the document, add list items at different positions and levels, and insert a non-list paragraph after the list.

methods.name: add
methods.description: Returns a `Paragraph` object that represents a new, blank paragraph added to the document.

params.name: range
params.description: The range before which you want the new paragraph to be added. The new paragraph doesn't replace the range.

examples.description: Add a new blank paragraph at the end of the document and insert text into it

methods.name: closeUp
methods.description: Removes any spacing before the specified paragraphs.

examples.description: Remove all spacing before paragraphs in the first content control to create a more compact layout

methods.name: decreaseSpacing
methods.description: Decreases the spacing before and after paragraphs in six-point increments.

examples.description: Decrease the spacing before and after all paragraphs in the document by six points

methods.name: getFirst
methods.description: Gets the first paragraph in this collection. Throws an `ItemNotFound` error if the collection is empty.

examples.description: Retrieve and display all annotations with their IDs, states, and critique content from the first paragraph in the current selection.

methods.name: getFirstOrNullObject
methods.description: Gets the first paragraph in this collection. If the collection is empty, then this method will return an object with its `isNullObject` property set to `true`. For further information, see [*OrNullObject methods and properties](/en-us/office/dev/add-ins/develop/application-specific-api-model#ornullobject-methods-and-properties).

examples.description: Check if a document has any paragraphs and display the text of the first paragraph if it exists, or show a message if the document is empty.

methods.name: getLast
methods.description: Gets the last paragraph in this collection. Throws an `ItemNotFound` error if the collection is empty.

examples.description: Insert an inline image at the end of a new paragraph that follows the last paragraph in the document body.

methods.name: getLastOrNullObject
methods.description: Gets the last paragraph in this collection. If the collection is empty, then this method will return an object with its `isNullObject` property set to `true`. For further information, see [*OrNullObject methods and properties](/en-us/office/dev/add-ins/develop/application-specific-api-model#ornullobject-methods-and-properties).

examples.description: Check if a document has any paragraphs and highlight the last paragraph if it exists

methods.name: increaseSpacing
methods.description: Increases the spacing before and after paragraphs in six-point increments.

examples.description: Increase the spacing before and after all paragraphs in the document by six points

methods.name: indent
methods.description: Indents the paragraphs by one level.

examples.description: Indent all paragraphs in the document by one level

methods.name: indentCharacterWidth
methods.description: Indents the paragraphs in the collection by the specified number of characters.

params.name: count
params.description: The number of characters by which the specified paragraphs are to be indented.

examples.description: Indent all paragraphs in the document body by 5 characters to the right

methods.name: indentFirstLineCharacterWidth
methods.description: Indents the first line of the paragraphs in the collection by the specified number of characters.

params.name: count
params.description: The number of characters by which the first line of each specified paragraph is to be indented.

examples.description: Indent the first line of all paragraphs in the document by 5 characters

methods.name: load
methods.description: Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call `context.sync()` before reading the properties.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides options for which properties of the object to load.

params.name: propertyNames
params.description: A comma-delimited string or an array of strings that specify the properties to load.

params.name: propertyNamesAndPaths
params.description: `propertyNamesAndPaths.select` is a comma-delimited string that specifies the properties to load, and `propertyNamesAndPaths.expand` is a comma-delimited string that specifies the navigation properties to load.

examples.description: Retrieve all paragraphs from the document body with their text content and font size properties.

methods.name: openOrCloseUp
methods.description: Toggles spacing before paragraphs.

examples.description: Toggle the spacing before all paragraphs in the document to add or remove extra space above them

methods.name: openUp
methods.description: Sets spacing before the specified paragraphs to 12 points.

examples.description: Add 12-point spacing before all paragraphs in the document body to improve readability

methods.name: outdent
methods.description: Removes one level of indent for the paragraphs.

examples.description: Remove one level of indentation from all paragraphs in the document body

methods.name: outlineDemote
methods.description: Applies the next heading level style (Heading 1 through Heading 8) to the specified paragraphs.

examples.description: Demote the first three paragraphs in the document to the next heading level (e.g., Heading 1 becomes Heading 2)

methods.name: outlineDemoteToBody
methods.description: Demotes the specified paragraphs to body text by applying the Normal style.

examples.description: Demote all heading paragraphs in the document to body text by applying the Normal style

methods.name: outlinePromote
methods.description: Applies the previous heading level style (Heading 1 through Heading 8) to the paragraphs in the collection.

examples.description: Promote all paragraphs in the document body to the previous heading level (e.g., Heading 3 becomes Heading 2)

methods.name: space1
methods.description: Sets the specified paragraphs to single spacing.

examples.description: Set all paragraphs in the document to single spacing

methods.name: space1Pt5
methods.description: Sets the specified paragraphs to 1.5-line spacing.

examples.description: Set all paragraphs in the document to 1.5-line spacing

methods.name: space2
methods.description: Sets the specified paragraphs to double spacing.

examples.description: Set all paragraphs in the document body to double spacing

methods.name: tabHangingIndent
methods.description: Sets a hanging indent to the specified number of tab stops.

params.name: count
params.description: The number of tab stops to indent (if positive) or the number of tab stops to remove from the indent (if negative).

examples.description: Set a hanging indent of 2 tab stops for all paragraphs in the document body

methods.name: tabIndent
methods.description: Sets the left indent for the specified paragraphs to the specified number of tab stops.

params.name: count
params.description: The number of tab stops to indent (if positive) or the number of tab stops to remove from the indent (if negative).

examples.description: Indent all paragraphs in the document by 2 tab stops from the left margin

methods.name: toJSON
methods.description: Overrides the JavaScript `toJSON()` method in order to provide more useful output when an API object is passed to `JSON.stringify()`. (`JSON.stringify`, in turn, calls the `toJSON` method of the object that's passed to it.) Whereas the original `Word.ParagraphCollection` object is an API object, the `toJSON` method returns a plain JavaScript object (typed as `Word.Interfaces.ParagraphCollectionData`) that contains an "items" array with shallow copies of any loaded properties from the collection's items.

examples.description: Export paragraph data from a document to JSON format for logging or external storage

methods.name: track
methods.description: Track the object for automatic adjustment based on surrounding changes in the document. This call is a shorthand for [context.trackedObjects.add(thisObject)](/en-us/javascript/api/office/officeextension.clientrequestcontext#office-officeextension-clientrequestcontext-trackedobjects-member). If you're using this object across `.sync` calls and outside the sequential execution of a ".run" batch, and get an "InvalidObjectPath" error when setting a property or invoking a method on the object, you need to add the object to the tracked object collection when the object was first created. If this object is part of a collection, you should also track the parent collection.

examples.description: Track paragraphs across multiple sync calls to maintain references when modifying their properties outside of a single sequential batch

methods.name: untrack
methods.description: Release the memory associated with this object, if it has previously been tracked. This call is shorthand for [context.trackedObjects.remove(thisObject)](/en-us/javascript/api/office/officeextension.clientrequestcontext#office-officeextension-clientrequestcontext-trackedobjects-member). Having many tracked objects slows down the host application, so please remember to free any objects you add, once you're done using them. You'll need to call `context.sync()` before the memory release takes effect.

examples.description: Load all paragraphs in a document, process them to get their text content, then untrack the collection to free memory after use.
